page.title: 03Ecology-St Leonards Forest
page.content: Forest was thought to have been named after St Leonard, godson of Clovis, King of the Franks who lived in 6th c.is not known to have visited Sussex and was the patron saint of prisoners. It is the most westerly of 4 large forests, about 12 sq miles which spread across Wealden ridge of Sussex. Horsahm and Crawley from the nth boundary with the villages of lowr Beeding and Handcross to south. It rises from about 80-130m on a dome shaped plateau of Hastings Beds.Dissected by steep sided gills which in turn feed Arun and Adur and the Ouse. It played a part in the industrial life of Britain with iron workings, which contiuned for many centuries. Sandstone was quarried and used for builidng many local houses.
